1.title: Hitagi kurabu sono ichi
1.plot: Part 1 of 2. On the day after the Golden Week holiday, third year high school student Koyomi Araragi finds himself saving a classmate, Hitagi Senjyogahara, by catching her when she slips on the stairs and comes tumbling down from above. He discovers that she's impossibly light, as if she has no physical weight whatsoever.

2.title: Hitagi kurabu sono ni
2.plot: Part 2 of 2. On the day after the Golden Week holiday, third year high school student Koyomi Araragi finds himself saving a classmate, Hitagi Senjyogahara, by catching her when she slips on the stairs and comes tumbling down from above. He discovers that she's impossibly light, as if she has no physical weight whatsoever.

3.title: Mayoi maimai sono ichi
3.plot: Part 1 of 3. On the 2nd Sunday of May. Koyomi meets Mayoi Hachikuji, an elementary school girl who is frantically comparing the town map displayed in the park to the memo in her hand. Learning that Mayoi has lost her way en route to a relative's home, Koyomi offers to help, only to be violently rebuffed.

4.title: Mayoi maimai sono ni
4.plot: Part 2 of 3. Koyomi meets Mayoi Hachikuji, an elementary school girl who is frantically comparing the town map displayed in the park to the memo in her hand. Learning that Mayoi has lost her way en route to a relative's home, Koyomi offers to help, only to be violently rebuffed.

5.title: Mayoi maimai sono san
5.plot: Part 3 of 3. Koyomi meets Mayoi Hachikuji, an elementary school girl who is frantically comparing the town map displayed in the park to the memo in her hand. Learning that Mayoi has lost her way en route to a relative's home, Koyomi offers to help, only to be violently rebuffed.

6.title: Suruga monkî sonoichi
6.plot: Part 1 of 3. May 22nd. Suruga Kanbaru, the school's biggest star who has led the underwhelming girls' basketball team to the national championships, begins to inexplicably stalk her upperclassman, Koyomi Araragi. When Hitagi Senjyogahara hears about this, she reveals that back in middle school, she was once so close to Suruga that they were known as the "Valhalla Combo."

7.title: Suruga monki sono ni
7.plot: Part 2 of 3. Suruga Kanbaru, the school's biggest star who has led the underwhelming girls' basketball team to the national championships, begins to inexplicably stalk her upperclassman, Koyomi Araragi. When Hitagi Senjyogahara hears about this, she reveals that back in middle school, she was once so close to Suruga that they were known as the "Valhalla Combo."

8.title: Suruga monki sono san
8.plot: Part 3 of 3. Suruga Kanbaru, the school's biggest star who has led the underwhelming girls' basketball team to the national championships, begins to inexplicably stalk her upperclassman, Koyomi Araragi. When Hitagi Senjyogahara hears about this, she reveals that back in middle school, she was once so close to Suruga that they were known as the "Valhalla Combo."

9.title: Nadeko suneiku sono ichi
9.plot: Part 1 of 2. On the morning of June 11th, Koyomi and Suruga travel to an abandoned shrine in order to perform a job for Oshino. As they climb the mountain the shrine is located on, they pass a girl running down the path, who only briefly exchanges glances before continuing in the other direction. Once they reach the shrine, Koyomi and Suruga discover a number of dismembered snake corpses in what appears to be some sort of ritual. They both quickly decide to leave. The next day, Koyomi and Tsubasa go to a bookstore, where they begin to converse. Tsubasa warns Koyomi ...

10.title: Nadeko suneiku sono ni
10.plot: Part 2 of 2. Meme Oshino has given Koyomi Araragi the task of heading to an abandoned temple on top of a mountain on the outskirts of town, and placing a talisman on the main shrine. Koyomi invites Suruga Kanbaru to accompany him, and the two are on their way up the deserted mountain path towards the shrine, when they pass a young girl running down, her hat pulled low over her head.

11.title: Tsubasa kyatto sono ichi
11.plot: Part 1 of 2. June 13th. The students are busy after class, getting ready for the last School Festival of their high school days, which will be held during the upcoming weekend.

12.title: Tsubasa kyatto sono ni
12.plot: Part 2 of 5. June 13th. The students are busy after class, getting ready for the last School Festival of their high school days, which will be held during the upcoming weekend.

13.title: Tsubasa kyatto sono san
13.plot: Part 3 of 5. June 14th. Mayoi tells Koyomi that she saw Shinobu Oshino goes out by herself last evening. After that, he gets an email from Tsubasa.

14.title: Tsubasa Kyatto Sono Yon
14.plot: Part 4 of 5. Koyomi visits Meme and Shinobu to ask for help about Tsubasa, but Meme tells him that Shinobu disappeared last night. Koyomi asks Suruga, Nadeko and Mayoi to look for her. Hitagi serves as a representative for Tsubasa to get ready for the School Festival.

15.title: Tsubasa Kyatto Sono Go
15.plot: Part 5 of 5. The night of June 14th. Finding why this incident happened to Tsubasa, Koyomi gets a great shock.

imdb.plot outline: Follows the adventures of Koyomi Araragi, a former vampire. One day, a classmate named Hitagi Senjougahara, a loner, falls down the stairs into Koyomi's arms. Hitagi appears to weigh next to nothing, defying physics. Despite being threatened by her to keep away, Koyomi offers his help, and introduces her to Meme Oshino, a strange middle-aged man living in an abandoned building, who cured him of vampirism. Koyomi becomes gradually more involved in cases related to unusual supernatural creatures, meeting new people and discovering secrets in the people he thought he knew.
imdb.title: Bakemonogatari
plot: Third-year high school student Koyomi Araragi is human again. Cured of his vampirism, he seeks to help other supernaturals with their problems. Koyomi becomes involved in their lives, revealing secrets in people he once knew.::TheUnbeholden
